item.title: Objectgraph Tag Hack
item.author: rbergero@gmail.com (RJ Bergeron)
item.description: Hacking in Facebook Object Graph Image tags for hugo posts Just detailing that as of this commit I added support for setting Facebook Object Graph preview-image settings in my Hugo templates. It was really to add in the front matter, actually, once I realized you can refer to anything in front matter under Params. The main tricky thing was FB wanted absolute URIs, so I had to use absURL (which I did, in the next commit).

item.title: Environment Variables Rule Everything Around You
item.author: rbergero@gmail.com (RJ Bergeron)
item.description: There’s lots of discussion for operating systems about processes, ipc, files and such, I wanted to take a moment and touch on some internals I find incredibly useful in my day to day work. Environment variables! NOTE: I’m really only covering Linux/OS X/POSIX class systems here, Windows (and PowerShell) have some slightly different edges. What Via Wikipedia - an environment variable is “a dynamic-named value that can affect the way running processes will behave on a computer.

item.title: Why I chose Hugo for setting up this blog
item.author: rbergero@gmail.com (RJ Bergeron)
item.description: So this site is set up using Hugo and I figure I’d detail a little bit of why. Static generator with a live updater One of the easier ways to do hosting is to have a simple collection of files to upload to a webserver, rather than building a server environment to run a blog engine. This also gives you the capability to more easily move your site between providers.
